Roasted Tomato Salsa

1 to 2 fresh jalapeño chiles
3 garlic cloves,
unpeeled 1 15-ounce can diced tomatoes in juice (fire roasted)
1/4 cup (loosely packed) chopped fresh cilantro
2 tablespoons fresh lime juice
Salt

Roast the chiles and garlic: 
1) In a small ungreased skillet over medium heat roast the chiles and garlic, 
until they are soft and blotchy brown(about 10 minutes for chiles, 15 minutes for garlic). 
2) Cool until handleable, then pull the stem(s) off the chile(s) and roughly chop. 
Peel the skin off the garlic. Scoop into a food processor and pulse until quite finely chopped.
Finish the salsa: 
Add the tomatoes with their juice.Re-cover and pulse until you have a coarse puree. 
Scrape into a serving dish.Stir in the cilantro and lime juice.
Taste and season with salt, usually about 1/2 teaspoon. You’re ready to serve.
Avocado Salsa

2 large ripe avocados from Mexico, peeled and seeded
2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh cilantro leaves
2 teaspoons finely chopped yellow onions
2 teaspoons minced jalapeno or serrano chiles, seeds and membranes removed, if desired
2 kosher or coarse salt
2 tablespoons cored, seeded, and finely chopped plum tomato (1 small tomato)
2 teaspoons freshly squeezed limejuice warm tortilla chips, for serving

Mash together 1 tablespoon of the cilantro, 1 teaspoon of the onion, 1 teaspoon of the chile, and ½ teaspoon of salt in the bottom of a molcajete or medium-size bowl. Add the avocados and gently mash with a fork until chunky-smooth. Fold the remaining cilantro, onion, and chile into the mixture. Stir in the tomato and limejuice, adjust the seasonings to taste, and serve with a basket of warm corn tortilla chips.
Tomato, Red Onion, and Paneer Salad

8 small ripe plum tomatoes, sliced
2 handfuls of arugula (rocket) leaves
6 cherry tomatoes, halved good splash of balsamic vinegar
1 small red onion, thinly sliced
250 grams paneer torn into pieces
Handful of fresh basil leaves, torn
Salt to taste and freshly ground black pepper
Generous drizzle of extra virgin olive oil

1.Put the tomatoes, red onion, and half of the basil leaves in a bowl.
2.Drizzle generously with olive oil, season well with salt and pepper, and toss gently to blend.
3.Arrange the arugula leaves on a serving platter; drizzle with a little olive oil and balsamic vinegar and season with salt and pepper.
4.Spoon the tomato mixture over the top. Scatter with the torn paneer and the remaining basil leaves.
5.Drizzle again with olive oil and balsamic vinegar and serve.
Pomegranate and Carrot Salad

Grated carrot - 2 Table Spoons
Pomegranate seeds - 2 Table Spoons
Pineapple - 2 Table Spoons (finely chopped)
Cabbage - ½ cup (cut into long strips)
Pepper powder - ¼ Tea Spoon
Salt - to taste
Olive oil - 2 Tea Spoons
Mustard seeds - for seasoning
Green chillis - ½ Tea Spoon (chopped)
Ginger paste - ¼ Tea Spoon

1. Take a pan and boil cabbage strips in it for about 5-10 minutes
2. Drain the excess water and keep the cabbage strips aside.
3. Take a mixing bowl and mix grated carrot, pomegranate seeds and pineapple pieces in it.
4. Add green chillis, ginger paste, boiled cabbage, pepper powder and salt to it and mix well
5. Finally season with olive oil and mustard seeds and serve
Mango Salsa

Mango - 1 (ripen)
Tomato - 1
Onion - 1
Cilantro - few
Orange juice - 1/3rd cu
Lemon juice - 2 Table Spoons
Jalapeno pepper

1. Wash, peel and chop your mango into small pieces.
2. Chop 1 big tomato into small pieces and add to the mangoes.
3. Now, add some finely chopped onions to the mangoes and tomatoes
4. Then, add some finely chopped cilantro
5. Now, add about 1/3rd cup of orange juic
6. Add 2 Table Spoons of lemon juice too
7. Add some finely chopped jalapeno peppers here from which we get the spicy taste
8. If you don’t finish it off as is from the bowl, scoop some salsa with some chips and enjoy the crunch
Fruit and Nut Salad

paneer - 1/2 cup (mashed)
mayonnaise - 1/4 cup
dates - 6-7 pieces (seeds removed)
canned peach - 6 pieces
cashew nut - 1/4 cup (roasted)
lettuce - 1/4 bunch (chopped)
Tomato - 1 (sliced)
green chutney - 2 Tea Spoon
Tomato chutney - 1 Tea Spoon

1. Take a bowl and mix paneer, mayonnaise, lettuce and green chutney and make a layer of it.
2. Mix dates, tomato chutney, peaches, cashew nuts and place it over the 1st layer.
3. Garnish with tomato slices.
4. Now the tasty fruit and nut salad is ready to serve
Carrot Salad

Grated carrot - 1 cup
Fresh Grated Coconut - 1/2 cup
Green chillies - 4
coriander leaves - 1/2 pac
Lemon juice - 1 Table Spoon

1. Cut Green Chillies into Small piece
2. Cut Coriander leaves into small pieces
3. Mix Grated Carrot, Grated Coconut and cut chilies and coriander leaves
4. Add lemon juice to it and mix well
5. Now the tasty carrot salad is ready to serve.
Raw Mango Salad

Green chilli cut - 1
Coriander leaves - few
Red chilli powder - ¼ Tea Spoon
Green mango - 1
Onion - ½ (cut finely)
Tomato - 1 (cut finely)
Turmeric - a pinch

1. Cut the raw mango into very small cubes.
2. Add to it the cut onions.
3. Put Red-Chilli-Powder and turmeric and mix well.
4. Then decorate it with few Coriander-Leaves.
5. Add salt just before serving to avoid oozing of water.
6. Can add little sugar if the mango is too sour
Rice Salad

Basmati rice - 1cup
Apple - 1 ( diced )
boiled green peas - 1small cup
Cauliflower florets - few ( boiled )
lemon juice - 1 Table Spoon
salad leaves - to garnish
Cabbage (shredded) - for garnishing
salt and pepper - to taste

1. Cook the basmati rice and allow it to cool
2. In cool rice add apples, green peas, cauliflower florets, salt and pepper.
3. Now add lemon juice and toss well and transfer to serving dish lined with salad leaves.
4. Garnish rice salad with shredded cabbage and coriander leaves
Beans Salad

White beans - 1/4 cup
Red kidney beans - 1/4 cup
Moong dal - 1/4 cup
French beans - 100 Grams
Onion - 1 (medium sized)
Fresh coriander - 1/2 cup
Mint - 1/3 cup
Green chillies - 2
Lemon Juice - 3 Table Spoon 
Chaat Masala - 1 ½ Tea Spoon

1. Wash white beans and kidney beans separately.
2. Soak them separately, overnight in plenty of water.
3. Wash and soak the green Moong dal for about two hours.
4. Boil the three dry beans separately in salted water till soft. Drain and let them cool.
5. Strain the French beans and cut into one-fourth inch pieces. Boil in salted boiling water till done.
6. Drain immediately (you may reserve the cooking liquid to use as stock for sonic officer recipe) and refresh with cold water. Drain and keep aside.
7. Peel and cut onion into one-fourth inch size pieces. Clean, wash, drain and chop green coriander and mint. Wash and chop green chilies finely. Peel and wash and chop it.
8. Dilute lemon juice with equal amount of water. stir in chopped green coriander, mint, green chilies and chat masala.
9. Shake well and refrigerate the dressing for at least an hour.
10. Mix all the cooked beans with diced onion and add the dressing. toss the salad to evenly mix the dressing.
King Crab Potato Salad

Potatoes-1lb
King crab meat-1cup
Scallions{finely copped}-3
Parsley{chopped}-2ts
Lemon juice-2tsp
Lemon zest-1/4tsp
Pepper to taste
Salt to taste
Shredded iceberg lettuce
Oil-1tsp

1.Quarter the potatoes, with their skins.
2.Boil them, until they are easily pierced with the tip of a knife (about 15 minutes).
3.Drain potatoes, and transfer to a mixing bowl.
4.Add the king crab meat, scallion, parsley, and lemon zest. Toss with a fork to combine.
5.Mix in the oil and lemon juice to coat the potatoes.
6.Season to taste with pepper.
7.Serve crab salad mounded on a bed of shredded lettuce.
Turkey Salad

Shreddd cooked turkey-21/2cup
Creamy Curried Dressing-1cup
flour tortillas-4
Papaya-1{peeled,seeded and sliced Crosswise}
blanched Silveredalmonds,toasted
Fresh Spinach leaves,stmmed,washed,and dried

1.Prepare Creamy Curried Dressing.
2.Mix together turkey and salad dressing in a large bowl. Refrigerate 2 hours
3.Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Wrap tortillas in aluminum foil. Heat in oven 10 minutes. Meanwhile, coat outside of four 10-ounce custard cups with nonstick cooking spray. Invert onto a baking sheet.
4.Remove tortillas from oven. Increase oven temperature to 400 degrees F. Place one tortilla at a time (keep others wrapped) on a prepared custard cup, pressing gently to shape. Bake tortillas in heated 400-degree F. oven 10 minutes. Carefully remove baked shells to a wire rack to cool completely.
5.Add papaya, kiwifruit, and almonds to turkey mixture. Line cooled tortilla cups with spinach leaves. Fill each shell with turkey mixture and serve.
Fresh Fruit Salad Recipe

1-2-3 Fruit Dressing Dressing (see recipe below)
5 to 6 cups of a variety of fresh fruits of your choice (be creative): 
Bananas, peeled and sliced
Blueberries
Blackberries
Cherries, pitte
Raspberrie
Strawberries
Green and/or red grapes, halved
Kiwi fruit, peeled and sliced
Pears, peeled and sliced
Peaches, peeled and sliced
Mango, skinned, cored and sliced
Oranges, skinned and cut-up
Pineapple, cored, peeled and sliced
Watermelon, flesh removed and cut into bite-size pieces, flesh removed and cut into bite-size piece
Melon (cantaloupe and honeydew), flesh removed and cut into bite-size pieces, flesh removed and cut into bite-size pieces

Prepare 1-2-3 Fruit Dressing; set aside until ready to use.
In a large bowl or container, combine all the mixed prepared fruits. 
Pour prepared 1-2-3 Fruit Dressing over the cutup fruits; gently toss to coat all the fruit. Serve family style or for a gourmet look, serve in chilled cocktail glasses.
To store, cover and refrigerate for several hours before serving.
Makes 8 to 10 servings.
